intro: Pseudalbizzia polycephala, commonly known as the many-headed acacia, is a shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its compound leaves, which are often alternate and pinnate, and its clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces elongated, flat pods that contain several seeds, typical of the Fabaceae family. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions. Pseudalbizzia polycephala is adapted to arid conditions and can withstand periods of drought.
